summary: the root of Glycyrrhiza uralensis is a well-recognized, natural sweetener. it is used as a traditional herbal medicine for the treatment of various pathological conditions, including allergies, liver disease, gastric ulcers, and adrenal insufficiency. licorice root contains triterpene saponins, flavonoids, polysaccharides and other substances. macrophage phenotypes are often referred to as classically activated macrophages (or M1) and alternatively activated macrophages (or M2). the phenotype is polarized by Th1 cytokines such as IFN- and is characterized by high capacity to present antigen, high levels of inflammatory cytokines (TNF-, IL-12, IL-6) secretion and increased levels of NO production.
